greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Look and Say sequence: describe the previous term! (method C - initial term is 2).
comment: Method C = 'frequency' followed by 'digit'-indication with digits in increasing order.

Converges to 21322314 at the eleventh term. Depending on the initial value, the sequence may converge to a cycle of 2 or more values, for example : 123456, 111213141516, 711213141516, 611213141516, 611213141526, 512213141526, 413213142516, 412223241516, 314213241516, 412223241516, 314213241516, 412223241516
a(n) = A005151(n) for n > 6. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 26 2014
example: a(1) = 12, so a(2) = 1112 because 12 contains a digit 1 and a digit 2; a(3) = 3112 because 1112 contains three digits 1 and a digit 2
maple: P:=proc(q,h) local a,b,c,k,n,x; x:=[h]; for n from 1 to q do
a:=convert(x[n],base,10); b:=0; for k from 0 to 9 do c:=numboccur(a,k);
if c>0 then b:=b*10^(ilog10(c*10+k)+1)+c*10+k; fi; od; x:=[op(x),b];
od; print(op(x)); end: P(27,2); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Aug 30 2018
program: f xs = (read $ concatMap show ys) : f (ys) where
ys = concat $ transpose [map length zss, map head zss]
results.author: Artemario Tadeu Medeiros da Silva (artemario(AT)uol.com.br), Mar 19 2002
